intro: [WRONG START] Idsia polycarpa var. longicarpa, commonly known as the long-fruited sugar maple, is a variant of the sugar maple native to eastern North America. It is a deciduous tree characterized by its distinctive palmate leaves and its ability to produce elongated, clustered fruits. The plant belongs to the family Aceraceae and is known for its ornamental value due to its vibrant fall foliage. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mixed hardwood forests. The species is also valued for its ecological role in providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
